  • Description: SequenceEvent: Container was found hissing and leaking gas by driver at vehicle. Container was removed and brought to the QA Cage where it was inspected for damage. Bottom of outer container was cracked, and lid was loose, even with zip ties holding it closed. Inner container had a loose cap, there was a zip tie which was removed during the inspection but the zip tie did not hold the cap in place. DescribePack: Crack on the bottom of the external container from one side of the container to about the midpoint. Lid loosely attached on external and loose lid on internal containers. External Container does not close without creative use of zip ties. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright and sealed using zip ties

The inner packing was also found wet from the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent sheets were used to clean up the liquid that was released from the ZEP bottles. The sheets used were then placed in a clear hazardous materials bag.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TEIX 30217 identified by train crew inbound with an odor from car. BNSF HM Responder identified a VRV engaging and venting from threaded area into car pressure plate with deteriorated o ring seat and also minor liquid release on pressure plate. Contractor replaced VRV with plug to secure vapor release and confirmed a loose vapor line and valve. Vapor line and valve removed, threads cleaned with reapplication of thread taper and secured pending OTMA to destination.

item.title: Report I-2023080057
item.description:
Report I-2023080057

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T00:34:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: Escondido
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: INGENIUM GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Waste material was staged onto a pallet with other materials then loaded onto an lngenium truck at the customer's facility. The shipment was then routed through the lngenium - Santa Clara transfer facility, then to the lngenium - Escondido transfer facility. Upon arrival, lngenium - Escondido operations began unloading the shipment from the trailer with a forklift. The pallet with the container in question was picked up and the container was squeezed between the forklift mast and the pallet. The container sustained a minor gash near the bottom then leaked onto the trailer floor. The driver continued to unload the pallet when another employee noticed the leak. The forklift driver placed the pallet down and backed the forklift out of the trailer. The driver donned his respirator, grabbed absorbent pads, and began covering the release. The second employee notified the manager. The material was contained before spreading. The used absorbent was removed and, along with the damaged container, placed in a salvage drum for disposal.
